description: A small, peaceful village on Dawn Island in the East Blue. This is Luffy's hometown where he spent his childhood and met Shanks.

keyEvents.title: Foosha Village Debut
keyEvents.description: Luffy's hometown is shown in flashback, where young Luffy meets Shanks and his crew.
keyEvents.significance: The birthplace of the future Pirate King and the location of foundational events in the series.

keyEvents.title: Shanks Departs from Foosha Village
keyEvents.description: Shanks and the Red Hair Pirates leave Foosha Village for the Grand Line after giving Luffy his straw hat.
keyEvents.significance: The departure that sets Luffy on his journey to become a great pirate.

description: A bar in Foosha Village run by Makino. This is where Shanks and his crew frequently gathered during their stay, and where young Luffy spent time with them.

keyEvents.title: Partys Bar Introduction
keyEvents.description: The bar where Shanks and his crew gather, and where Luffy spends time with them.
keyEvents.significance: The setting for many crucial moments in Luffy's childhood.

keyEvents.title: Luffy Eats Devil Fruit at Partys Bar
keyEvents.description: Young Luffy accidentally eats the Gomu Gomu no Mi while at the bar with Shanks' crew.
keyEvents.significance: The location where Luffy gained his devil fruit powers.

keyEvents.title: Higuma Confronts Shanks at Partys Bar
keyEvents.description: Mountain bandit Higuma arrives and insults Shanks, leading to the chain of events that results in Shanks losing his arm.
keyEvents.significance: The confrontation that sets up one of the most important moments in the series.

description: An island in the East Blue that contains Foosha Village, Luffy's hometown. The island is also home to Mt. Colubo where Luffy trained as a child.

keyEvents.title: Shanks Loses Arm at Dawn Island Coast
keyEvents.description: At the coast of Dawn Island, Shanks saves Luffy from the Lord of the Coast but loses his left arm.
keyEvents.significance: The location of one of the most pivotal moments in One Piece history.

statusHistory.reason: Inhabited island in the East Blue

description: A town in the East Blue that has been taken over by Buggy the Clown and his pirates. The town appears damaged and mostly deserted when Luffy and Zoro arrive.

keyEvents.title: Luffy and Zoro Arrive at Orange Town
keyEvents.description: Luffy and Zoro arrive at Orange Town seeking supplies, finding it deserted and damaged.
keyEvents.significance: Beginning of the Orange Town arc and setup for the confrontation with Buggy.

keyEvents.title: Nami Appears in Orange Town
keyEvents.description: Nami is first seen in Orange Town after stealing from Buggy's crew.
keyEvents.significance: The location where Nami is introduced to the series.
